四人修电机，一人挂腊肉。

基友都是骚操作，四个人穿的一样在我面前秦王绕柱，我却一条腊肉都挂不上。
但，基友开黑哈哈哈哈哈就完事了呀~

Good game

Very enjoyable to play with friends, playing alone is still alright but will get frustrating quick when playing as a survivor as the lack of communication with randoms will get you killed quick. However playing killer is fun, takes a while to get decent at it but once you do it becomes amazing to play.
I do warn you though, the game is very toxic at times so be aware of that.

Výborně skloubená hororová atmosféra s velkým množstvím postav a mechanik. V kooperaci skvělý zážitek, ale i v solo hrách hraje tým dobře (většinou). DLCčka za pár dolarů jsou výborným spestřením. Chytlavá hra. Stejně návykové hrát za survivora nebo killera. I po 300 hodinách nepřestává bavit.

I recommend so long as you're ok with losing a piece of your soul every time your team sees you on hook and ignores you until you die for no reason or you get cheated out of hits that should have landed but the game decided that you personally should suffer. But it balances out when you get that one SEAL team that plays like the match is a highly coordinated mission or you just have that one game where you battle against the odds and triumph against the survivors in a climactic ending that leaves you hooked on the pain game like an addict not realising that that game was one in a hundred. That's where the magic of this game really happens.
这是一款好游戏，屠夫哥哥很热情，一直请我吃苹果，经常替我考虑键盘寿命的问题，上树守到升天，坚决不让我在碰键盘。我们的游戏里面没有bug，我们只是在bug里玩游戏。

I highly recommend this game if you love a roller coaster of emotions. Think of the best single player story experience you've ever had. The highs and lows, the gripping character development. Now condense that into roughly 20 minute matches. Matches that will leave you over whelmed with joy, euphoria, frightening terror, absolute frustration and pure sadness because a competent survivor team with a total of 5000+ hours just took a dump on you as you used the last of your good add ons or the piece of #### killer has tunnelled you all game and you say farewell to the last of your purple beamers. GG tho and GLNG <3

And then we all forget, that this game is still trash. 0/10, wouldn't recommend, and yet I'll still play it...

This game is super fun. it has some major balance issues in some areas (as all asymmetrical multiplayer games do). However, it can easily be made a lot more enjoyable if you just don't focus too hard on winning. just let the game play out and see how it goes, you get rewarded even if you lose. Maybe get some friends to play with you and have even more fun!

Editing this review.

I wish there was more to a review than "Would you recommend this game?"

This game has its ups and downs.

I would only recommend it if you have friends to play with. Solo servers suck, everyone has bad manners and it is way too competitive. There was also an influx of cheaters, and I just feel like no match I play (esp. as killer) is fun anymore. There is no creativity with perk builds, everyone looks the same, and they are such bad mannered like tea-bagging at the exit and clicking their flashlights (considered bad manners in game). It's annoying because it feels unwarranted.

That being said, is this game fun? Yes, it is so much fun, but what isn't fun is when you are a new player and people bully you, i.e. baby/ez killer etc. I wish there was a way to play "casually" on solo servers, and not expect a sweat fest every match, or practice more. I want more practice without being put into a full fledged match.

It's sad to see a game I had so much love for dissipate as time goes on, concept wise its amazing and its impressive to see the amount of skill/playtime required. There are some awesome loopers, fun games and the such but its hard to focus on the good when a majority of matches dont seem that way.

You're probably better off watching someone play vs. playing itself if you don't want to deal with that. There are very skilled players who play this game and I would give them a watch instead of getting this game. I find myself taking longer and longer breaks from DBD, which saddens me.
